intro: Aframomum polyanthum, commonly known as the African grain of paradise, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. Its rhizomes, which are rich in essential oils, are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The botanical features of Aframomum polyanthum make it an important species in both horticulture and ethnobotanical research.
